meanings.definition: To destroy a large proportion of something
meanings.sent1: The wildfire decimated the forest, leaving only a few trees standing.
meanings.sent2: The virus decimated the population of rabbits in the area.
meanings.sent3: The hungry caterpillars decimated the farmer's cabbage patch in no time.
meanings.sent4: The economic crisis decimated the company's profits, causing layoffs.
meanings.sent5: The tornado's path of destruction was so severe, it seemed to decimate everything in its way.

meanings.definition: To kill or destroy a large number of people
meanings.sent1: The plague decimated the village, leaving few survivors.
meanings.sent2: The warlord's army decimated the opposing forces in a single battle.
meanings.sent3: The zombie movie showed hordes of undead creatures trying to decimate the human population.
meanings.sent4: The evil sorcerer cast a spell to decimate the kingdom's inhabitants.
meanings.sent5: The alien invasion threatened to decimate all life on Earth.

meanings.definition: To severely reduce the strength or effectiveness of something
meanings.sent1: The lack of funding decimated the research team's progress on the project.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected betrayal decimated the alliance between the two kingdoms.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick to decimate the opponent's deck of cards amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds threatened to decimate the fragile flower garden.
meanings.sent5: The harsh winter conditions decimated the survival chances of the small animals in the forest.
